title: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
name: Backbone Trail
address: Eastern Trailhead: 1501 Will Rogers State Park Rd Los Angeles, CA 90272; Western Trailhead: Thornehill Broome Campground
content: The Backbone Trail is a 65-mile (soon-to-be) continuous route between Point Mugu State Park and Will Rodgers State Historic Park. A great way to experience the diverse scenery and ecology of the Santa Monica Mountains. There are still two short gaps along the route; At the crest of Little Sycamore Canyon Road, and a short stretch in Encinal Canyon. Connecting trails are currently proposed, and the missing sections can be circumvented along the roads.
